comment: Hard to really review the professor himself because the class is basically just completing numerous Connect and Simnet assignments every week with the occasional discussion post each month. I am not sure a different professor would have made any difference, but this class was basically just doing busy work for 8 weeks. Would avoid if possible.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Online Savvy

comment: I took Professor Cochran during the summer and it wasn't easy to manage. Course work was heavy. You would definitely have to work ahead, and I mean it. There were weekly Connect reading assignments along with a quiz. 2 exams (midterm and final). Excel, Access, and Cumulative SIMnet assignments. The SIMnet assignments are time consuming.

Very heavy workload even for an 8 week summer course. Around 3 assignments and 3 quizzes per week. Excel, Access, and a Cumulative sections on SIMnet. A midterm and final is mostly second half but some first half ideas stuck in. Did not create any of the content; used McGrawHill for everything. Unclear at times with communication. Don't recommend.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Stay away from this guy for any online class, especially IS3100. Literally choose any other professor. There is so much work for an 8 week class and he offers no extensions on ANYTHING despite your reasoning. So much extra stuff that I didn't have to deal with in an IN PERSON, semester long IS2100 class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: This professor is bad, and I mean really bad. His workload is so unnecessarily heavy and the assignments are not easy. Going to class will not help you at all. Please take this class with another professor.

Please never take this class if you have the choice, wait another semester for a different professor. From the unnecessary amounts of work, with awful duedates and times, to lectures that have no use in assignments or anything on tests. To even if about everyone fails a midterm not bothering to curve or accept that the test was unright. pls avoid
Great professor.. I really learned alot... it's just a lot of work... easily the most involved class I've taken

Vague assignment instructions, unclear communication at times, heavy workload.

Simnet assignments (excel and microsoft access), smartbook, discussions, and quizzes make it really hard to stay on top of this class.

I would strongly not recommend Dr. Cochran. His assignment instructions are vague, his communication with the class is poor, and the workload is VERY heavy, especially on Simnet and discussion boards. He is also strict on deadlines and not willing to work with you. Recommend you find another professor.

Currently halfway through this class. I just spent 3 days straight, 11am-9pm trying to complete his Simnet assignments. You will have HEAVILY graded discussion posts and horribly long adaptive reading assignments, sometimes 2 due in one week. He is firm on deadlines. HE TREATS THIS CLASS LIKE IT'S THE ONLY CLASS YOU ARE TAKING.
probably the worst professor I have had. He did not communicate well with the class at all. It was so much work. He was really unfair about some assignments and grading. DO NOT recommend.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: He has a "value added" metric to his grading. Only take this class if you're willing to put in the needed time. If paced out properly, this class is not that bad as all the other comments are saying. It's definitely not easy AT All. Wish people knew the difference...

You actually have to work in this class. He isn't just going to give it to you and answers are not easily found. With that being said, he is a solid professor that really wants his students to learn. If you need help just ask and he'll help

Took a long time to post grades.  Have to go WAY above and beyond to get an A.  It's achievable with hard work.  CAN NOT coast in this class!  Lots of discussions, group project, several assignments, mid-term, and final.  Kind of confusing because directions and due dates for some projects were left over from previous semester online classes.

Professor Cochran never returned grades before 3 weeks later, grading deductions conflicted with assignment instructions. He took off excessive points for minor items. He did not lecture, nor provide any expertise. He did not proactively communicate in any way whatsoever. Lukewarm delivery of what could be a very fun and meaningful course!

Do NOT take this teacher.  You will not receive a grade for your fist assignment for nearly two months.  His instructions are vague and the team project is ridiculous.  Team project consists of a webpage, presentation, and formal detailed report to be completed in a month ON TOP of individual work he assigns. This teacher will ruin your GPA.

Dr. Cochran gave very vauge instructions.  I took the class online, and he expected so much from you.  I do not reccommend him AT ALL. The amount of work assigned became ridiculous.  The only helpful thing was talking to classmates through VISTA.
Took it online. Not very helpful and rarely available. The assignments were graded harshly and the team project requirements were ridiculous. Do not recommend him at all!

One month into the class and the first assignment hasn't been graded. Rarely answer's student posts and is condescending when he finally does.  If you take this class, expect to teach yourself.  This might as well be a textbook-based automated class.  This instructor is worse than having NO instructor.

I had Cochran for an online class. True, he rarely gives 100's, but A's and B's aren't hard to receive. He gives out A TON, of work! Taking on this class can EASILY triple your work load, but I'm pretty sure all the BISM (IS) classes have the same work requirements. I'd say his class is an easy B as long as you're prepared to do all the work!

Cochran's class did require a lot of work and time dedication, but it really isn't that hard to complete all of the assignments and receive a high grade.  Just be sure to choose your groups wisely when you start the group project.  Also, it's not difficult to get a 100 any of Cochran's assignments, it just requires a fair amount of effort.

Can we say very tedious work??? But honestly, you have to respect a teacher of this nature. From my aspect in working in Corporate America, the topics addressed are basically what corporate America is about. It is alot of work, but its to help you. Some say they didnt get 100's on any assignments.I received 100's with a overall A in the class. H

Vague on instructions for assignments. Not very approachable or of any help to students. Looked forward to this class to start to my major, and this professor made it a bad experience. Will not give a 100 on ANY assignment that he grades personally, thus making it VERY difficult to get an A when he continuously takes off nit picky points.
He's ridiculous to say the least. He makes you do at least 2 or more assignments per week. And he grades ridiculous he refuses to give you a 100 on any assignment. Nobody likes him.

I took Cochran's online class and it wasn't bad. There is lots of busy work!!! Cochran is really nice and helpful and he wants his students to do well. He is always quick to respond to questions. There is a big team project so choose you team wisely.

Online Class. LOTS of work but if you work ahead you will get it all done. Gives a little extra credit. A few quizzes, 2 tests, projects, discussions, websites, papers, all due weekly pretty much. But it's not hard and I usually spent less than a few hours a week doing the work. VERY clear what he wants. Pretty easy A if you do the work.

The online course is so much easier than the actual class at KSU. I dropped the course last semester and took his online course and got an A. The work is tough and you have to do it everyday, but I would recommend this course over any other that is taught in the classroom.
